website_summaries.verdict: Small and light enough to fit into a car trunk, but sturdy and comfortable for its size.
pros: Sturdy build and comparatively lightweight at 45 lbs
Versatile configuration with movable arm and leg rests
Adjustable leg rests are a big help
cons: Lacks shock absorbers, so rolling outside can be bumpy
Leg rest cushions can detach after a few weeks of use

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I might have ever made in my life..
customer_reviews.text: This chair improved my Mom's way of life. It gave her a little bit of her freedom back that she had lost due to medical issues. It has been a big help to my Dad also. Anyone looking for a good wheelchair with a lot of good options, small enough to maneuver around the house and light enough to easily fold and lift into the trunk of a small car. This is a very good choice all around. Debated for too long on which chair to purchase. I'm glad I chose this one. Even better quality than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!! Armrests are very small ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!! Armrests are very small, user could not use the armrests to hold on while getting up. The box is very thin & tore beyond use while trying to get the item in because it was a very tight fit and I could not get the bars and leg rests in the box. After calling four places to find a bigger box, I found a UPS store and they had to use two boxes put together to fit everything. It costs $28.00 to return ship and another $64.00 for the two boxes. ($32.00 each). Total Nightmare and not worth the hassle. Giving one star was too generous of me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chair and Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It was easy to assemble and arrived quickly. I find it very easy to self-propel on a variety of floor surfaces, including carpeting. The leg extension feature is great, as I have a broken ankle and must keep my leg extended. The chair is easy to push and very sturdy. The 16" wide seat allows this chair to fit easily through standard-sized doors in our home.The cut-away arms allow me to work at a desk on the computer or sit close enough at a table to eat meals.
customer_reviews.author: S Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel chair!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for all the great reviews that helped me choose this amazing chair. It is perfect for someone recovering from knee replacement surgery. The legs elevate well and it is sturdy yet comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: it's easy to manage
customer_reviews.text: My 78-year old mother purchased this wheelchair to assist with ease of mobility outside of the home to and from medical appointments. We have used this wheelchair on a few occasions. Once you become familiar with its moving parts, it's easy to manage. It's lightweight, yet sturdy. It's easy to fold and place in your rear seat or trunk. Mom hasn't mentioned any discomfort while using this wheelchair. It is a tremendous help when we are trying to get to appointments in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Desperately Seeking Quality

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Broke my left heel. Needed this chair badly. Works great and it was delivered fast. Thank you Medline and Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Karen Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Warning!  Read Before Purchasing This Product
customer_reviews.text: Chair arrived on time. Frame welds were bad and upon opening, the seat broke! Have been fighting with manufacturer to refund shipping it back to Amazon. Would NOT recommend buying any product from Medline. Their customer service is not customer servicing oriented.
customer_reviews.author: Terra Ridge

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my second wheel chair, so I have experience with features and value on them. For the money, this is a great wheelchair. I have been using it for the past 3 weeks and have no complaints or concerns with any of the accessories and their features. The chair glides very smoothly. The leg rests lock in solidly and are easy to remove. The leg height adjustment can be raised easily using the pad of your foot or by hand, with no binding. The back rest detaches easily. I highly recommend this chair for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy this because of reviews, then I noticed they had some on Marketplace, Amazon, for a cheaper price. Brand new, already assembled, except for the feet. To me it was a steal at the original price, lightweight enough for this 64 yr old woman to get into the car, after my husbands foot surgery. Easy fold up for transport. Doesn't take up a lot of room either. Get it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: 2 Ragdoll Cats

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money if you plan on using daily outside of the home / care facility
customer_reviews.text: This was fine for a couple weeks of use, but with a few weeks of use we are replacing this chair. The wheels have no traction and sit uneven and the chair feels unstable. If you plan on using this chair in many locations spend more and buy a better chair.
customer_reviews.author: FarmFan

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality chair for occasional use. Medline makes good stuff. Wife (71) had knee surgery needed something to transport her for a few weeks after surgery when a fair amount of walking was required. Folds and unfolds easily. Slightly heavy to lift into my SUV. If you are strength challenged I would look for an Aluminum framed chair. Assembly was easy just put the footrests and arms on the chair. Medline does not include instructions on assembly nor on how to adjust the chair I could not find any instructions on their web site.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Self-loosening bolt, otherwise solid
customer_reviews.text: My only real complaint is that the bolt that is supposed to hold the brake in place (see photo) loosens up, no matter how hard I crank it down, leading me to feel as if the brake is going to fall off at any moment. It only happens on one of the brakes (the right side)... Design flaw that could have been avoided by using a locking bolt or washer. Other than that, it is fairly comfortable for long hours, very maneuverable, and the arms lifting up and out of the way is a convenient feature. I'm also a fan of the desk-length arms, which allow for comfortable computing, dining, etc. For being so inexpensive, a solid chair all around.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: I broke my ankle two weeks after buying chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought chair for times I wasn't able to walk long distances. It turned out I haven't been ab!e to walk at all for last six weeks. I'm really glad I have chair. I went to zoo yesterday and spent all day in it. It was actually pretty comfortable . It maneuvers well in tight spaces and fits up to table in restaurants. I'm very pleased with my choice of chair.
customer_reviews.author: poopsie

customer_reviews.title: Good wheelchair for a person who is wheelchair bound for a length of time.
customer_reviews.text: Spending at minimum 6 weeks in this wheelchair. I find it easy to use. Comfortable for a wheelchair and easy to pull it up close to bed, toilet, etc. The legs can be moved to the side or removed. It is light enough so my husband has no problem folding and lifting it into the back of our van.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K Hernly

customer_reviews.title: this wheel chair has been a great aid. I paid $174 for the chair which ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently broke her ankle and had surgery. She is immobile for now, and with all of the visits to the doctors, this wheel chair has been a great aid. I paid $174 for the chair which was surprising, but the quality of the chair was excellent. The back is adjustable, the arms unlock and move out of the way and the foot rests elevate, mover out of the way to the sides, or can be removed if not used. Breaking is great too. Quality of the chair is also very good. I don't think you will be displeased if you purchase this chair.
customer_reviews.author: IBMrT

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my father-in-law. Initial setup was simple. My 5' 5" wife can place it in the Acura TL trunk, remove it, and unfold it just fine. Considering it's portability, it's solid and comfortably holds for my father-law is about 5' 9" 200 lbs. medium build with a ponch. The notched, moveable arms are great for when we take him to places with tables.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Lever unlocks on foot rest when I don't want it to.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I got the arms that raise up so I can reach the floor. I have spent a lot of time in the chair and my only real complaint is that themlever (shown in photo) keeps unlocking on its own. Then the foot rest can raise without me wanting it to. I cannot adjust this lever to tighten it. If I had it to do over again I would have spent a bit more and gotten a chair that can recline a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie K.

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONE you want!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONE you want for maneuvering and comfort. Fits my average inside doors but not narrow bathroom size doors. Folds in half to fit in our trunk and tucks away or against a wall at a restaurant. I've been in and out of wheelchairs (rented, borrowed and donated) for 5 years because of broken femur, tibia, fibula, n ankle - totaling 7 surgeries and implants. Now that I'm very familiar with manual wheelchairs (and excrutiating pain subsided) decided to select my own. This model is better than any rental I've used, or those rickety things at most doctors' offices.
customer_reviews.author: Jaleys

customer_reviews.title: Smash finger
customer_reviews.text: WATCH OUT! The brake lever on the left side is too close to the chair frame. You WILL smash your finger between the lever and the frame. Also, a plastic plug that goes in the end of the frame tubing in front is missing. This is very disappointing, but it will be too much effort to ship it back. There is no guarantee that a new one will be any better. In the pictures, you can see there is no room for fingers except for the very top. The last picture shows the right side, and the fact that there is room for fingers. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bair

customer_reviews.title: if you are on a fixed income this is a big chunk of money for something that is so useless. i had to have my arm xrayed do ...
customer_reviews.text: the chair does not roll well on carpet very hard to move. the bars under the seat you can feel in a few weeks. the flip back arms damage your walls,also if you have a small bath room they knock every thing off your vanity. the brakes lock up if you go into a door way the wrong angle they catch on door frame and lock.don't buy this chair.i'v been in a wheel chair for 5 yrs. this is so poorly designed. if you are on a fixed income this is a big chunk of money for something that is so useless.i had to have my arm xrayed do to the strain of trying to roll the chair on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: worth mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: My 94 year old aunt suffers from a knee problem which prevents her from walking. I bought her this Medline lightweight wheel chair in hopes that she could shuffle her other foot to move her chair. Unlike the larger standard size chair, this one moves much easier for her, is so much easier to maneuver through doorways and around furniture. She recommends it! And she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: The momma is thrilled with her wheels
customer_reviews.text: The price was so unbelievable. I went through all the reviews waiting to find a few discouraging ones. Couldn't find one. I doubt you will either. My mother (near 87) loves this wheelchair. Perfect for those times she is just too tired for walker. Safer when stepping out of shower for something more solid to sit on and get dressed. When using portable vacuum for floor the wheelchair works better for her than walker. She uses her legs to push herself around. Hip replacement. 3 back surgeries and she never thought to get a wheelchair. She's much happier. It's a great value. Well made
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 94 year old friend and we're both impressed with the build quality and functionality. I would recommend purchasing the anti tip accessory for leverage when needing to lift the front end to get over curbs or doorway thresholds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: MY SISTER IS SO HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair literally has made my sisters life so much easier, she has Cerebral Palsy and has her legs get tired as she easily gets muscle spasms! However thanks to this wheelchair and the beautiful leg rest(which elevate) this issue has been minimized big time! I almost forgot to mention i love not having to change her from one seat to another!
customer_reviews.author: David Rojas Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: See the headline. The legs are a bit intrusive. Only need to use one [stroke victim] and heavy use will let me adapt to it, or modify. That will happen only when I spend more time in the chair. That will happen some day, but--for now--I will do my best to keep hobbling along. Besides, walking [or my unreasonable facsimile thereof] past the chair in my storage/laundry room makes me very happy... very happy indeed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: its easy to maneuver on flat ground cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: its cheap, its light weight, its easy to maneuver on flat ground cons: its cheaply built, support bar under seat presses through the seat fabric which cuts off circulation, any uneven ground and you're stuck, the leg supports are slippery and tilted inward so I finally tied my leg down to keep it attached, and the leg support also has a lever in front that my wife called the "excitement switch" because if anything bumps into that hair-trigger lever you're broken leg is taking a very sudden and unexpected fall to the ground... who that of this design!?! Wish I had spent another $100-$200 bucks for something worth sitting in.
customer_reviews.author: Avoganic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!! Worked great for the small time we needed it.
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more happy!! The value of the chair alone was worth it. The chair is great quality. Our son (11) had a full leg used this chair every day for 4 weeks and I mean used it. He went to school- went outside- went through grass etc. Popped wheelies and was pretty rough of the chair. It had zero problems holding up. It was light enough for me to lift and put in my SUV every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not right for my house
customer_reviews.text: When it came it was missing a necessary bolt. Couldn’t have anyone push because it’s what kept the handles straight. It wasn’t a run of the mill bolt but an Allan bolt. I couldn’t use the hand wheels to make you go forwards or reverse, I just made the wheel spin and no go anywhere. The company that sold the wheelchair said it was an environmental problem — carpet. I told them that my house mostly was carpeted. They said there was nothing they could do so I returned it since I bought it through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great chair and well made
customer_reviews.text: Great chair and well made. Unfortunately I had to return it because my father did not feel comfortable sitting in it. He said he felt like he was leaning forward. I believe this was due to a forward curvature of his spine and not the chair. I believe a chair with a reclining back would be better for him.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Pick up this chair
customer_reviews.text: This product is anything but light. I need the chair picked up. I can not lift the thing. I need to set up a pick up even if it costs me extra. I just want the thing off my front porch. I didn’t order it it. It is a mistake that it was ever delivered. Please get back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Handleman

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: This chair has been a godsend to me as a caregiver, and to my husband as a wheelchair dependent person. At home or when we travel he has a (fairly) lightweight motorized wheelchair that I can manage on a limited basis. Local, short trips to doctors visits or for that rare (these days) dining out experience this chair is perfect and essential.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Scott

customer_reviews.title: ok for short term use
customer_reviews.text: It folds without too much hassle and fits in the trunk of the car. Overall stability isn't that great. I am 5'4", 124lbs and my husband says it isn't the smoothest wheelchair to push. For the price, I think it's not too bad and does what I need it to. I will only be using for surgery recovery but wouldn't want this wheelchair if it was for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor design in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I have an issue with this chair. When you unfold it to be able to sit on it the cross-members, which is the main framework of the chair, they hit your legs on each side about where they meet your butt. Poor design in my opinion. We had borrowed a Dalton brand chair from the church before I ordered this one and it didnt have this problem. Hope this helps anyone else thinking of buying this particular one.
customer_reviews.author: R. K.

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting seat and installing leg rest
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have an engineer to adjust seat height and install leg rests, forget it. Very clumsy and heavy leg rests and instructions for installation are useless. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: very good transport chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair was just what we need to transport my husband when we are confronted with any distance - he has trouble walking. He is a big man & the chair suits him & is easy for me to push. He can propel the wheels as well. The chair folds easily & I am able to lift it into our SUV. It is tight at the limit of my lifting ability, however. Someone weaker will have a problem. (I'm pretty strong .) It is sturdy & seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Stevans

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight,  easy to use,  clean!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wheelchair! It's better than any you can use at the hospital! Our anywhere! Only wheelchair better is one that that is motorized!! This wheelchair has strong plastic wheel handles for pushing I like better than metal on my hands!! Metal leaves a residue! Maneuvers well! Turns on a dime!
customer_reviews.author: Bea Hanson

customer_reviews.title: not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: where the feet go when the hooks get stuck and when you want to take them out this is hard to take off look for another option
customer_reviews.author: Walter sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheelchair!
customer_reviews.text: Great wheelchair. It’s comfortable, light, and easily maneuverable. I’ve been in it daily for over 2 months now and it’s still like new.
customer_reviews.author: Hugodonna

customer_reviews.title: Great folding chair
customer_reviews.text: Great wheelchair; very maneuverable, more comfortable and closes easier than our previous chair. We added a backpack since there is no rear pouch. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: GLM

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. Shipped fast
customer_reviews.text: The chair works great. I added a Memory Foam Coccyx Orthopedic Seat Cushion which I found on ebay. Also I used some thin rubber non-slip material to help keep the cushion in place.
customer_reviews.author: MikeWest1

customer_reviews.title: Good company!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a replacement due to an alignment issue and this company came thru! Not the lightest offered but worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: lauriepalm

customer_reviews.title: Good for when you need a light duty chair to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good for when you need a light duty chair to throw in the trunk for quick trips to the doctor. Alittle smaller and lighter than the full size heavy duty model they make. Surprisingly comfortable for what it is. A little short on the thigh support. It; lightness and slick wheels makes it slip sometimes when moving on smooth floors and going over small bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Easy for most women to use by themselves.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wheelchair I could lift into the trunk of my car, pleased to have found one. I will have to add the foot support and leg pad after I remove it from the trunk of my car as they add weight. I’m able to use the wheelchair without those for short periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Dena.

customer_reviews.title: Good for short term use!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look and price of the wheelchair. I have been using this for more than a month. I feel like this is good for use for 3 months or less, definitely not for long term. It's easy to move around, very easy to fold and compact. The only cons are it's not light weight and the wheels sometimes leave black marks on my floor
customer_reviews.author: Amaz

customer_reviews.title: Well made with many features.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this wheelchair because my wife fractured her ankle. With many choices available we decided on this one for several reasons; the size was perfect for getting around our home, the weight was light enough to transport in our SUV, and the manufacturer has a good reputation in the medical industry.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Need to be clear on what you are selling
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my brother who is 180 lbs and the wheelchair was so small I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Mia

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful chair.
customer_reviews.text: After falling and breaking my femur at 61. This chair was Wonderful for me. Extremely easy to maneuver everywhere, light weight and easy to wheel around myself at my age. Wonderful product. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is for a large man, so I am happy that this is lightweight. It was very easy to assemble. Perfect for us!
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Chair Breaks
customer_reviews.text: One of the brakes is not functional. It doesn't stay in place. Even the therapists cannot explain why the break gets loose right after been pushed to secure the wheel. This was a brand new item, used by my daughter, who weight now 111 pounds from 70 pounds initially. Have anyone had the same problem and how was resolved? Is there anyway to make a claim on this wheelchair?
customer_reviews.author: EUNICE

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: For this price, I would expect the quality of the wheelchair to be at least decent. The made quality of this chair is very bad, and it is hard to fold and open.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This wheel chair with the elevating leg support was great to use during my knee surgery recovery. Was able to keep my leg elevated and do some things around the house during my recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Frydadddy

customer_reviews.title: Very EASY to use !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST wheel chair that I would recommend - and I never write any product review but this is the very first one !!! I am a girl and have been concerned about how to use and fold / unfold a wheel chair with frequent use for our family members. This one is a no brainier and SO EASY to fold and unfold - very best and a lot of compliments from the hospital staff too !!!! Must have if you are looking for one !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice wheelchair for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice wheelchair for the money. Pretty durable, reasonably easy to fold, heavy but not excessively heavy, and built pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great for the person using it.
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for me to get to the bathroom and back but is a little heavy for my daughter to get in the car when we have to go to the doctor or other appointments.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia a. diehl

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: If you need a Wheelchair this is the one to consider. It's small enough to get thru most doors. It's light weight, and well built. The last hospital and nursing home that I was in had the very same model. IT WILL STORE IN A SMALL SPACE. IN MY OPINION, IT WORKS LIKE A CHAMP.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Sperry, Williamsburg, VA

customer_reviews.title: My home wheels
customer_reviews.text: Received my wheelchair Tuesday. Have been very happy so far. Beats the Rolo-walker. Can sit in chair and get around much easier. Not using the leg support. Not needed at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Borla

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: the rubber wheels are ultra cool design. the quality is fantastic. I can maneuver easily. The break away arms allow you to work at your desk. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: bigdoggy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to push
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to push than the old clunky one we had before. And it's pretty comfortable too. Wish it were just a tad wider though.
customer_reviews.author: Julieb

customer_reviews.title: This wheelchair was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair was easy to put together, lightweight and maneuverable throughout my home. The only disadvantage is that the foot rests can get in the way of turning through standard sized doors to enter another room. I took the foot rests off and find the chair to be very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Carla J. McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product that provides support for a leg that needs to be elevated. Many ways to adjust it. Very stable to use as leverage to stand up. I bought the VIVE cushion which allows me to spend 8 hrs at work. The chair is okay, for me, without a cushion for about 2-3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara D.

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to my mother in law when she came to the US for a visit. Very quality, used it all the time, was easy to use, she could go everywhere because of that. And of course she took it home with her. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Adi

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Even though I will only need this chair for a short time period, the cost of renting one was $45 a week,this one has so many bells and whistles that, I will keep this incase a family member ever needs one..
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: A true lightweight wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Truly is lightweight. Manuevers very well. Able to make tight turns if need be. Easy to fold. Nice size.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Did not like - does not fit through doors as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not like - does not fit through doors as well as prior Drive Medical wheelchair, especially with side attachments (the knobs which lock the wheels from moving stick out to the side too far and hit sides of door opening).
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Block

customer_reviews.title: top quality and very light.
customer_reviews.text: my husband uses this chair for clinic and hospital appointments. the light weight and design make it very easy for me to help him move about. if folds for storage into a neat package that does not take up much room. we are very happy we found it on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: cjm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic wheels
customer_reviews.text: Only concern that I have is that the back wheels are a hard solid plastic, not the traditional air filled rubber wheels. I thought that they might scuff my hardwood floors, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: The description said lightweight but it was very heavy. It's a good quality product just far from lightweight. We had to send it back. It shouldn't be described as lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick W.

customer_reviews.title: Give it a chance
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was perfect, but my husband the passenger wasn’t happy. He found the chair narrow and couldn’t get comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people with limitations
customer_reviews.text: This product is one I can recommend. It is much lighter than conventional wheel chairs. Keep in mind that it can be cumbersome, but always remember to engage the wheel locks and you will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: pat J

customer_reviews.title: Mostly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver for us. It affords greater mobility. I do not know what we would have done without it.. My husband learned to maneuver it very quickly. Turns on a dime!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ghirardini

customer_reviews.title: Soo good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its good for the price , i bought for my mam and she said its Comfy
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived safely. Great product. Perfect for mom. No complaints. Well-constructed wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Rozak

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Well built - comfortable - somewhat cumbersome in the house with leg extensions mounted - No problem with the extensions off - I added cup holders and that helps to be able to use both hands on the wheels to propel the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Saber 6

customer_reviews.title: Did not ship without minor damage
customer_reviews.text: Wheel chair arrived with a broken piece from the wheel spoke. Still works ok, needed it so unable to return. The wheelchair itself appears sturdy but was not packaged properly for as big and heavy as the package was.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Dad. Mom and Dad said it was much better than the one the insurance sent. They said it was much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Trivette

customer_reviews.title: Medline Wheelchair had a broken part
customer_reviews.text: chair had a broken part ..I am returnig the Medline for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: bill f

customer_reviews.title: An OK wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Part of the back of the armrest is damaged. Easy to maneuver but a little heavy for me to put away.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Three

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair is very easy to maneuver and is very easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.author: Kandi Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good for light to medium use.
customer_reviews.text: My mom likes her chair, it had made her life easier. Good for day to day occasional use. Not for folks who have to have it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair buy or rent.
customer_reviews.text: My wife was in hospital for a few weeks had a hard time walking. I got a wheelchair to make it easier for both of us. the last time we needed one we rented and we should have purchased one. Other people in the family will use it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Zentner Sr

customer_reviews.title: I love this wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: I love this wheelchair,good value for the money! The only change I would have them make would be to change the wheels from a composite wheel to a pneumatic type of wheel ! That would be my only reason for not giving it a 5Star rating!
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE E.

customer_reviews.title: Entry level chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect entry level chair. Works and rolls perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Safe mobility.
customer_reviews.text: This chair was purchased for someone who uses it to move around the house. We like that the seat height is adjustable yet the chair is not heavy. It moves through our house nicely and can be placed at a table for eating/working.
customer_reviews.author: rita k cook

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a transporter to wheel my sister around in because I thought it would be lighter and easier to handle. However...this chair is as lightweight but easier to push because of the larger rear wheels.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.MEE

customer_reviews.title: Very Best Wheelchair!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, sturdy but lighter than expected. Excellent in every way. Takes a lot of weight and it’s just perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.author: TrishBVA

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this w/chair for my mom who lives on acaribbean island. This item is very sturdy, well built, and has lots of features that i overlooked when i made the purchase. The PT mentioned that this brand item is at the top of the list. So far there is no issue with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Not the best purchase for price
customer_reviews.text: The left wheel spins in place often when trying to roll or turn. After two days both wheels “skid” in place. I got stuck on the sidewalk yesterday and couldn’t move until a pedestrian walked by and gave me a push! 😡🤬🤬
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and well made. Works great. There is no safety strap with ours as described though. Better than paying $40 a month to the home for one of their old used wheelchairs.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair but not a lightweight as I had hoped. I can close it, but it is a bit hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and secure.
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair is lightweight and comfortable. It folds as described and provides a smooth glide.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Looks just like the one at the hospital.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use . My wife loved it , it is comfortable to set in most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my father before he needed surgery and physical therapy. It helped quite a bit around the house for him. The chair is very light for the sturdiness and size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again. Worked well for my needs. Not fancy but comfortable easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: G. Willikers

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a wheelchair, this one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Eichhorn

customer_reviews.title: Wheel chair
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are too slippery on carpets and hard wood floors, very hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Eyas Dudin

customer_reviews.title: this is a good one!
customer_reviews.text: Since I have to be in a wheelchair, this is a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Allan W. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Normal quality
customer_reviews.text: It is normal, good quality but is not the best, and is not light weight
customer_reviews.author: ana leon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: Best wheelchair we have found. Very sturdy and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: dhark

customer_reviews.title: Swift and free moving
customer_reviews.text: Smooth movement , but slightly heavy , hand rests are not long enough
customer_reviews.author: Chidatma

customer_reviews.title: excellent chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Only negative is it is fairly heavy, but all features work very well.
customer_reviews.author: M.R. Green

product_meta.title: Medline Lightweight & User-Friendly Wheelchair With Flip-Back, Desk-Length Arms & Elevating Leg Rests for Extra Comfort, Gray, 18" Seat
product_meta.description: Size:18 x 16 InchThis smartly designed, lightweight Medline Wheelchair is simple to maneuver yet sturdy enough to support people weighing up to 300 pounds. A great choice for on-the-go users who want the easy Access of flip-back desk arms and the enhanced comfort of elevating leg rests. The adjustable backrest moves up and down for customized support.
feature_bullets: Flip-back, desk-length arms make it easy to navigate under tables | elevating leg rests enhance comfort and remove easily
Breathable nylon upholstery is soft and comfortable
Premium welds ensure reliability and durability
Smooth-rolling Mag wheels with low-maintenance flat-free tires; foot-powered movement with 2” seat-height adjustments (hemi-height)
300-Lb. Weight capacity | 33-lb. Product weight, without leg rests. Latex free; Not MRI safe

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
